item.title: 21/September - Version Control with Git and GitHub
item.description: 1. Install Git ðŸ’¾ First! Check if you already have git installed, open your command line and run: 1git --version If you see something like the following output then you already have git installed: 1git version 2.x.x Otherwise, here are instructions to install Git: For Windows For MacOS 2. Sign up to GitHub ðŸš€ Sign up here: https://github.com/join Why? We will use it in the class to store our code It can be used to collaborate with others It can be used to showcase your work 3.

item.title: 30/September - Using an IDE (Integrated development environment)
item.description: Prerequisites 1. Install VsCode Visual Studio Code is a freeware source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. Features include support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git. Wikipedia During this course, while working with HTML and Pything we might end up working with an code editor to make easier interacting with files and folder. An editor can be considered the notebook of a programmer.
